loans.use: to buy face creams, body creams, make-up and silver jewelry in different styles.

loans.name: José Omar

texts.es:
El Señor  José Omar, de oficio zapatero, casado, empezó como empleado de un taller de zapatería desde hace 9 años,  pero conforme el tiempo el decidió tener su propio  negocio, empezó  a comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo, actualmente tiene 12 trabajadores, sus puntos de ventas las realiza en Managua, Matagalpa y dos compradores que estos viajan a Honduras.   

Se presenta nuevamente  a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un financiamiento para poder comprar cuero para elaboración de calzado (materia prima) ya que la demanda esta fuerte. Considera que este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y darle una mejor comodidad a su familia les agradece por su apoyo ya que le han servido de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
José Omar is a cobbler by trade. He is married. He started out as an employee at a shoemaking shop nine years ago, but in time he decided to start his own business. He began purchasing his own work tools, and he currently employs twelve workers. His points of sale are Managua, Matagalpa, and two of his buyers travel to Honduras.   

He has returned to our offices to request financing in order to purchase leather for shoemaking (raw material), because there is a strong demand. He believes this loan will help him increase his income and make his family more comfortable. He appreciates your support, because it has been of great help.

loans.use: to purchase leather for shoemaking.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Eleuterio agricultor y transportista actualmente cuenta con 56 años de edad vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es productor de café convencional tiene interés en cambiarse a café orgánico, esta dispuesto a recibir asistencia técnica y a seguir las instrucciones por parte de los técnicos de la Unión Regional de Huatusco para lograr dicho cambio. Para Don Eleuterio es muy importante aumentar  y mejorar su producción de café ya que es su actividad laboral principal, la mayor parte de las fincas fueron heredadas por una tía las demás fueron compradas producto de la venta del café y de las ganancias generadas por la renta de un camión transportador de caña que posee, sus metas a mediano y largo  plazo son renovar las plantas viejas con nuevas y así aumentar su producción, por tal motivo pide un crédito para la compra de plantas para resiembra y para labores culturales donde le ayudaran a marcar su parcela y a sembrar las plantas aumentando su producción y mejorando la calidad de su café el podrá aumentar su calidad de vida y así poder cumplir su mayor ilusión la cual es que sus hijos sean profesionistas pero sin olvidar el trabajo de campo ya que las parcelas que hoy posee serán su herencia en el futuro.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is a farmer and transportation provider.  He’s 56 years old and lives with his wife and two children.  He grows conventional coffee and is interested in switching over to organic coffee and is willing to get technical assistance to do so and to follow the instructions from technicians from Unión Regional de Huatusco [coffee cooperative] to attain said change.

For Eleuterio it’s very important to increase and improve his coffee production since this is his main source of work.  Most of his growing fields were passed down from an aunt and the rest were purchased with profits from coffee sales and profits generated from a sugarcane transport truck he owns.  

His medium and long range plans are to renew his old plants with new ones to increase production which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy the plants to replant and to pay labor costs to help him mark his parcel and plant his plants increasing production and improving the quality of his coffee to be able to improve his quality of life and attain his greatest hope which is that his children become professionals but without forgetting work in the fields since the parcels he now owns will one day be their inheritance in the future.

loans.use: to buy plants and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria madre soltera de 56 años de edad vive con su hijo es productora de café orgánico, actualmente produce 12 toneladas por cosecha y le gustaría en un futuro llegar a producir 20 toneladas, ella cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café una parte de sus fincas fueron herencia de su padre las demás fueron compradas con las ganancias que le deja la producción de café, en la actualidad se dedica a las labores del hogar y en su tiempo libre al cuidado de su finca, sus metas son lograr mas producción y comprar mas parcelas y por lo consiguiente producir mas y mejor café, su mayor ilusión es poder comprar una camioneta pequeña que le facilitara el transporte de su café a la Unión Regional de Huatusco que es donde lo vende, por lo cual pide un crédito para realizar sus planes que son comprar plantas para resiembra y compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para aumentar su producción y obtener una mejor calidad de vida llevando con ello el aumento de su patrimonio y así poder comprar su camioneta para facilitar el transporte de su café, jornaleros y fertilizantes que ocupe en el cuidado de su parcela.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, is a single mother; she lives with her son.  She is an organic coffee grower currently producing a 12-ton harvest.  She’d like in the future to reach 20 tons.  She has 30 years’ experience growing coffee.  Part of her fields was inherited from her father and the rest was purchased with profits from coffee sales.  

She currently works doing household chores and cares for her fields in her spare time.  Her goals are to achieve higher yields and to buy more parcels of land to produce more and better coffee.  Her greatest hope is to be able to buy a small pick-up truck that will make transporting her coffee to Unión Regional de Huatusco [coffee cooperative], which is where she sells, it easier.

This is why she’s asking for a loan to carry out her plans to by plants to replant and to buy organic fertilizer to increase production and obtain a better quality of life bringing with it an increase in her assets to be able to buy a pick-up truck to make coffee transport easier.  She will also hire day laborers and buy fertilizer she will need for her fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 27 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Air Port Community. She sells  baked cookies in the market. 

Garmai is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase flour, sugar, butter, fresh milk, and charcoal  for her business. In the future, she will like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, butter, fresh milk, and charcoal.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción casada vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo cuenta con 76 años de edad y con experiencia en el cultivo de café desde ya hace 50 años ya que desde muy pequeña su padre la llevaba a la finca a que lo ayudara en las labores de siembra y cosecha del mismo, todas las fincas que posee son herencias de su padre, también cuenta con otras actividades laborales que son la caña de azúcar, costura de ropa y vende medicina popular de la región, su educación llego hasta el nivel secundaria ya que en aquel tiempo era muy difícil asistir a la escuela por la distancia de un poblado a otro y no había muchos medios de transporte como en la actualidad. Su mayor ilusión y meta es aumentar su producción de café  ya que ella produce su propia planta para resiembra  y por tal motivo pide un crédito para  la compra de fertilizantes y el pago de labores culturales con los cuales tiene pensado aumentar su producción por cosecha y el resultado del mismo  a largo plazo será de  poner una tienda de abarrotes con la cual  aumentara su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Concepción’s married living in her own house with her husband and her son. She’s 76 years old and has 50 years’ experience growing coffee since her father would take her to the fields when she was a little girl to help him with the planting and harvesting chores.  All of the fields she owns were inherited from her father.  She also does other activities like sugarcane and sewing clothes and she also sells popular medicine in the region.  Her education reached secondary school since back then it was difficult to attend school because of the distance from one settlement to another and there weren’t many means of transportation like there are today.

Her greatest hope and goal is to increase coffee production since she produces her own plants for replanting and this is the reason for requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs for the plant maintenance chores she plans to do to increase crop yields.  She plans to use profits from which in the long run to open a grocery store that will increase her and her loved ones’ quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for farm chores like pruning, weeding and harvesting and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo agricultor y ganadero de la zona de Huatusco, Ver. Cuenta con 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos, cultiva café desde hace ya mucho tiempo pues desde niño su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con el oficio, es productor de café orgánico el cual vende a la Unión Regional de Huatusco. También cuenta con otras actividades que le dejan un poco de ganancias extras las cuales son el cultivo de caña de azúcar y la ganadería. Para Don Hugo su familia es muy importante. Lo que mas quiere es ayudarlos a salir adelante, especialmente a sus hijos que son su mayor inspiración. Por lo cual ha decidido pedir un crédito para mejorar su finca de café con la compra de fertilizantes, compra de plantas para renovación  y para el pago de labores culturales de manera que con ello se pueda obtener una buena cosecha que hará posible que mejore sus ingresos así como también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hugo is a farmer and cattleman in the Huatusco, Veracruz zone.  He’s 45 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  He has grown coffee for a long time since his father taught him everything related to the occupation when he was a boy.  He produces organic coffee that he sells to Unión Regional de Huatusco [coffee cooperative].  He also has additional activities that produce a bit of extra profit which are sugarcane production and animal husbandry.

For Hugo, family is most important.  What he most wants is to help them get ahead, especially his children who are his greatest inspiration which is why he’s decided to ask for a loan to improve his coffee farm buying fertilizer, plants to renew and to pay labor costs for the farming chores so that he can obtain a good harvest that will make it possible for him to improve his income as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plants, fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María  es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos como carga familiar.Vive en el Anexo San Miguel del Caserío Cruz del Médano, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope.
La actividad que realiza María es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales negocia quincenalmente. Ella cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, los alimenta con polvillo y pastos naturales. María también se dedica  a las ventas de hielo,  marcianos y bodoques en su domicilio, así como  pescado. Cuenta con buena acogida del público que es parte de su clientela. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero en un molino de arroz, lo cual le apoya en la canasta familiar.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán destinados a invertirlos en la compra de animales y en sus respectivos alimentos, y también en compra de pescado para negociar y hacer crecer su negocio. De esta manera se generan más ingresos  que permiten mejorar la calidad de vida de María.
texts.en:
María is a 27 year old woman. She is married and has two dependent children. She lives in Anexo San Miguel, in Caserío Cruz del Médano, which is 20 minutes away fron the city of Mórrope.
The activity María performs is raising and selling animals, which she sells bi-weekly. She raises her animals in farmyards located outside her residence. She feeds them rice powder and natural grasses. María also sells ice, flavored ice, and frozen juice-bags from home, as well as fish. She has received a good response from the public comprising her customer base. Her husband works as a laborer in a rice mill, which contributes to their family income.
The loan amount requested is 2500 nuevos soles, which will be put towards investing in the purchase of animals and their respective feeds, and also in the purchase of fish for sale, which will expand her business. This way she will generate more income, which will allow María to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing feed and animals, and also to purchase fish.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, a 35-year-old business woman, lives in Juba where she is married and has a 17-year-old child who attends school. For the last three years Juan has run a mixed-food business. Having heard about Finance Sudan from friends and a radio advertisement, she is requesting a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase more items such as water, sugar, beer, etc.

Juan's major challenges include low income and the high cost of goods. Within five years, she would like to convert her operation into a wholesale one. Juan says that she appreciates Finance Sudan’s efforts in supporting South Sudanese people.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as water, sugar, beer, etc.

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en: Vazifa is a widow and a caring mother of four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling animals for over two years.  She has good experience in this area. She has previously received a loan from VFAC and has a good credit history.  Now, Vazifa wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 700 AZN in order to buy 10 lambs.

loans.use: to buy 10 lambs.

loans.name: Cina

texts.en: Cina, 58 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is married and has five children, all living on their own. Her husband is a church pastor. For the past 34 years, Cina has been selling oil, rice, pepper and others items in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items for her business. Cina started this business with money given to her by her husband. Her plan is to build a house for her children and family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and other items

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es: Sotero con 53 años de edad soltero vive con su madre asistió hasta sexto grado de educación primaria cuenta con 41 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café todas sus parcelas fueron heredadas por su padre, con el cual empezó a trabajar a la edad de 12 años ayudándolo en la siembra y cosecha de café. La cual es su actividad principal y único sostén para él y su madre, Sotero dedica todo su tiempo a sus fincas ya que el mismo realiza durante el tiempo de floración de la planta algunas labores culturales como son la poda y el chapeo para cuando el café este listo para ser cosechado estén las fincas limpias, es productor de café orgánico actualmente cuenta con 4000 plantas en su finca le gustaría aumentar a 6000 plantas productivas su meta es aumentar su producción y comprar mas terreno para sembrar mas café.  Por lo cual pide un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayudaran a aumentar su producción y para las labores culturales como son el pago por jornal de los trabajadores que contratara para que le ayuden a preparar su finca para la poda la limpia y la siembra de plantas. Implementando esto el cree que a mediano o largo plazo él pueda aumentar su producción y por lo consiguiente aumentar su calidad de vida de igual modo sus patrimonio y poder arreglar su casa y poder comprar una camioneta que le hace tanta falta para el traslado de fertilizantes y materiales a su finca.
texts.en:
Sotero, 53, is single living with his mother.  He attended elementary school up until sixth grade.  He has 41 years’ experience growing coffee; he inherited all his fields from his father having started working with him at the age of 12 helping with planting and harvesting coffee.  This is his main and only source of support for himself and his mother.  Sotero spends all his time in his fields since he himself does some of the farming chores like pruning and weeding during the plant flowering phase so that when the coffee is ready to be harvested the fields are clear.  He produces organic coffee and currently has 4000 plants in his farm.  He’d like to increase to 6000 productive plants and his goal is to increase production and to buy more land to plant more coffee.

He has therefore asked for a loan to buy organic fertilizer that will help him increase production and to pay labor costs to hire personnel to help him with the farm chores like pruning, weeding and planting.  He believes that by implementing this in the medium or long term he will increase production and as a result will improve his quality of life as well as his assets and will be able to make improvements to his house and to buy a pick-up truck that is so very much needed to transport the fertilizer and other supplies to his farm.

loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in West Point along with her husband and children, who are presently in school.  For the past five years, she has been selling fashionable clothing in her community.  She has many customers and makes good profits, especially during the holiday season, because she is the only one who sells fashionable clothing in the community.  

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fashionable clothes for her business.  She plans to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 33-year-old married man who has four children aged one to twelve years old. He describes himself as forceful and diligent.

For the past nine years Jack has operated a shop where he sells items such as rice, drinks, bread, detergent, sweets, etc. The shop is in a busy area where local residents are his customers. A lack of funds is his biggest business challenge.

Jack is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more household goods to sell. His ambition is to run a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie, 39 years old, lives in Compound #3 with her four children, aged between 6 and 15, all in school. For the past two years, Marie has been running a cook shop (restaurant), where she sells delicious Liberian food. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. Marie is requesting a loan to buy more rice, onion, pepper, oil and charcoal for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onion, pepper, oil and charcoal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 29 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is single and has 4 children aged between 6 months and 7 years. They all live at home and the oldest ones are  attending  school. For the past four years, Mercy has been selling fresh meat in the market. She started this business with the help of her mother. Mercy is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh meat for her business. Her plan is to support her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh meat for her business

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu, 24 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is single and has 2 children aged 2 and 8, both in school and living at home. For the past 4 years, Jartu has been selling rice, palm oil and okra in the market. She started this business with her mother's help. Jartu is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil and okra for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil and okra for her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie, 40 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is married and has 4 children aged between 15 and 28, all living at home and attending school, For the past  six years, Annie has been selling fish and palm oil in the market. She started this business with her mother's help. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in Airport Community.  She is 45 years old, widowed and has five children between the ages of 10 and 27 years that are in school and live at home.

She has been selling palm oil in the market since 1990 to sustain her family.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more palm oil for her business.  Her plan is to continue helping her children to see them educated through high school.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shelves, closets,  stock and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years Faridah has been working hard to manage her small business selling fresh fruit.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruit for resale and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and save her money for future use. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop.

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to start a new retail shop business. He intends to add stocks of maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat to his retail shop. Through his previous loan, Francis was able to increase his monthly income due to increased profit. He could be able to increase his purchases and aims at opening a wholesale in the future. The loan has really changed his family's living standards. Francis is able to pay fees to all his children without any burden.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat for his shop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, 41 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is single and has 7 children aged between 2 and 23, living at home and attending school. Her children's father works in security and helps to provide food in their home. For the past  ten years, Martha has been running a shop where she sells rice wholesale in the market. She started this business with her mother's help. Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. Her plan is to give her children higher education in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for their support. She used a previous loan to greatly improve the living standards of her family, including better health care and higher quality education. Her goal is to open a wholesale food company, but for now she sells various food items from a kiosk. Her previous loan allowed her to increase her monthly income by over 40 percent. She is applying for a loan for KSH 55,000 to buy more food items to sell, including sugar, and wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joyeuse

texts.en: Joyeuse is 25 years old. She is married to a cell phone dealer. She sells accessories for the cell phones and she has spent three years in the business. With the loan, she will buy more phone accessories to sell. She plans to use the profits to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Florent

texts.en: Florent is 23 years old. He is single. He has been running a boutique for the past two years. He wanted the loan to buy more merchandise to sell in the boutique such as beans, salt and sugar. With the profits, he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 23 years old, married and has two children who are ten months and five years old. Her older child goes to school, while she has earned a living for the last five years by selling hand bags. She has requested a loan to buy more hand bags to sell. With the profits made possible by this loan, she will pay for her older child's tuition.

loans.use: to buy more hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Marina Martha

texts.es: Doña Martha y su esposo Amadeo producen café desde hace varios años. En el pasado se vieron afectados por el bajo precio que hubo de su producto sin embargo siguieron trabajando pues por experiencia sabían que con el tiempo el precio del café volvería a subir. Gracias a su esfuerzo y entusiasmo lograron salir de esa mala racha y actualmente están produciendo un total de 6 toneladas por cosecha de café orgánico con calidad de exportación, el cual entregan en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”. Además de la producción de café ella se dedica a las labores propias del hogar y también cultiva algunas flores las cuales vende para uso decorativo en jardineras. Doña Martha sabe que si sigue trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho en 3 años podrá aumentar su producción de café al doble por lo que necesita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y plantas nuevas para sus fincas. Ella y su esposo tienen un hijo al le han enseñado a trabajar en el cultivo de café para que en un futuro también pueda dedicarse de lleno a esta actividad la cual les ha servido a ellos como principal ingreso en su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Martha and her husband, Amadeo, have been coffee growers for many years.  In the past they were affected by the low price coffee had however they continued working because they knew that in time coffee prices would rise again.  Thanks to their effort and enthusiasm they were able to make it through the bad stretch and they are currently producing a total of 6 tons per harvest of organic coffee of export quality which they deliver in its entirety to “Union Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative].  Besides growing coffee, she also does household chores and grows flowers that she sells for decorative use in planters.

Martha knows that if she continues working like she’s done to date in three years she will be able to double coffee production and to do so needs a loan to buy fertilizer and new plants for the farm.  She and her husband have a son they’ve taught to work growing coffee so that in the future he too will be able to work full-time in this activity which has served them well as their main source of family income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en:
Famatta is 29 years old and married with two children ages six and seven. Her children are in school, but she herself did not receive a formal education.

For the past six years Famatta has sold used clothes and plastic dishes (cups, plates, etc.). The rainy season is an obstacle to her business, though.

Famatta is requesting an 18,000 LRD loan from BRAC to buy more used clothes and plastic dishes to sell. Her ambition is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and plastic dishes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Compound #3. She is 23 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years old. One of her children is in school and all of them live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past four years, she has been selling palm oil, bitter ball, okra and pepper. She started this business with money from her husband. One problem she faces is that she doesn't have enough money. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, bitter ball, okra and pepper for her business. She learned this way of trade from her mother. She likes it because it makes her serious and strong and is a fast way of getting money. Her plan is to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, bitter ball, okra and pepper

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 37. She is a mother of five children who are between 2 and 19 years old. Four of them are enrolled in school. She has been running a hair dressing salon for the past nine years. With the loan, she plans to buy more hair products for use in the salon. She has a plan to use the profits from the business to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con el propósito de formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son jefas de familia que deben de llevar el pan de cada día a sus casas y es por ello que siempre se esfuerzan el doble, ya que no quieren que sus hijos pasen por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Lilia es una de las miembros del grupo, y nos comenta que ella tiene muy buena pasta para la venta, por lo que le va muy bien en su despensa. Se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de progreso y entusiasmo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio, como ser carnes, bebidas, lácteos, panificados, enlatados y demás.
texts.en:
12 women from the city of Santaní got together for the purpose of forming a group of women entrepreneurs from Fundación Paraguaya. They are the heads of their households and must feed their families every day. For that reason they always work very hard since they don’t want their children to go without as they did. 

Lilia is one of the members of the group. She tells us that she has a lot of good things to sell and that things are going well in her shop. She considers herself to be a hardworking person who values progress and enthusiasm. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy basic goods like meats, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and other items with which she will supply her business.

loans.use: to buy meats, drinks, baked goods, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 4 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her small tailoring business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes for resale, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and save her money for future use. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teddy's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes for resale

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with six children and three of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (Grandchildren). She sells fish from home and sells to all categories of people but at retail. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of fish.  Besides this fish business, she owns a retail shop. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of boxes of fish from the landing site to her home.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her vegetable stall business. With the loan, she intends to purchase sacks of fruits, green vegetables and fruits. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 25 years old. She is very energetic in her business, which she has been doing for the past three years. She sells shoes. She wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en: Unice is a 25-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has one child who is two years old. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a beauty salon. She has two employees, and learned about Finance Sudan from the friends and a radio advertisement. She is taking a loan of SDG 1,500 to buy supplies for her salon, including hair weaves and dryers. In five years, her goal is to be own a wholesale business. Her major challenges include a low income and the high price of supplies. Unice wants to express her appreciation for Finance Sudan’s effort to encourage women to enter business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 25 years old. Her husband works as a driver. For the past five years she has operated a shop where she sells different groceries such as rice, salt, biscuits and sugar.

Clementine is requesting a 400,000 RWF loan from UOB to be used to add more groceries such as juice, sodas and cooking oil to her shop. She plans to use the profits from her business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to add more groceries to her shop.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
Maria tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su hermano y sobrino en el Municipio de Esparta, Atlántida.
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace 4 años estableció un negocio de venta de mercadería en general como Ropa, carteras, sandalias y achinería en general. Su negocio funciona en su casa donde acondiciono un local para vender su mercadería. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien y ha generado ganancias rentables. Con la administración y con la ayuda de los prestamos obtenidos con ODEF las ganancias las ha sabido distribuir ampliando su inventarió, y hace 2 años logro establecer otro negocio de pulpería. Ella atiende sus dos negocios, Ofreciendo variedad de productos tanto en mercadería como productos alimenticios.
Solicita su cuarto préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para surtir más su negocio en Ropa y achinería nueva. Para que sus ingresos sean aun mayores y de las ganancias obtenidas poder reinvertir en el negocio.
Su meta es ampliar mas el negocio para generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, single, and lives with her brother and nephew in the town of Esparta, Atlántida. She is a hardworking woman. Four years ago, she established a general retail shop where she sells clothing, handbags, sandals, and trinkets. Her business operates out of her home, which is equipped to function as the storefront for selling her merchandise. Maria says that she is doing very well and is able to generate good profits. Through good management and the help of the loans she obtained from ODEF, she has been able to use her earnings to expand her inventory. Two years ago, she opened another business -- a grocery store. Now that she manages two businesses, Maria is able to offer a variety of products including food items.

She is requesting her fourth loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with clothing and the latest trinkets. In order for her income to grow and generate more profits, she needs to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to expand her business even more so that her revenue will improve.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and a variety of trinkets.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is taking another loan of KSH 50,000 to expand her existing business. She intends to purchase bundles of new clothes to sell.

The previous loan was able to increase her monthly income due to the increase in profit. Gladys aims at expanding the existing business to a wholesale business. The loan has really changed the living standards of her family. She’s able to provide a good education to her children without much burden.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She owns her own home, with access to electricity and piped water. Mary’s monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past ten years Mary has run a clinic (her only source of income). Thieves and seasonality are her major business challenges.

Mary has applied for a 2,500,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of drugs such as syrups and other tablets. Her ambition is to see her business grow into a full hospital. She also wants to build rentals in an area near her home.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of drugs for her clinic.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is 32 years old. For the past three years she has sold onions to earn money.

Brigitte has requested a 300,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more onions to sell. With her profits she will buy yet more onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with three children, all enrolled in school. She operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business, and was previously a water vendor. She has been in this business for the last two years. Josphine owns a house that has electricity and piped water. She is married to Dzuya, a businessman. 

Her business does not do well during the rainy season, which poses a challenge to her. She aspires to hire employees in the future, and she describes her greatest monthly expense to be school fees.

With the Ksh 80,000, she plans to buy another motorcycle for business operations.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for her business operations.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 51 years old and lives in a village in the Imereti Region with his wife, son, daughter and mother. He earns a living by growing maize on his land and selling cheese he produces from his four milk cows. He also uses some of his crops to feed his cows. His total average monthly income is 1,000 Laris. David is applying for this loan to start up a new business. He will buy chickens and raise them in an old hen house that is located in his yard. He will also use some of the money to feed his chickens. After three or four months, David will be able to sell eggs as well as chicken. The new business will give him additional income to use to support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en: Immacule is 31 years old. She sells utensils, which she has been doing for the past seven years. With the loan she wants to add more utensils to sell. In the future, she plans to make more savings from the profits.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is married and has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. For the last six years, she has earned a living by running a pub.  She works in the pub and sells to all types of people on a retail basis. She is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda and gin. Her major business challenges include transportation of supplies and a failure of customers to pay bills. Her goal is to expand her business into a full-service pub. Justine lives in a home that she rents and where her family has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda and local gin.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Don Oscar Danilo, casado, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro sus hijos y su esposa, tiene de experiencia 11 años la cual adquirió con su papa que era el oficio del cual se dedicaban, actualmente el ya posee su propio taller de mueblería, conforme el tiempo se ha  perfeccionando de tal manera que a ido elaborando todo tipo de productos tales como recamaras, gabinetes, puertas y muebles mil uso, comedores, entre otros en fin a tratado de ir teniendo una gran variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra madera de cedro, sener, sellador, tablas de aguacates, lijas, pega y galones de tintes. Y se presenta a Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo y abastecer su negocio de materia prima-
texts.en:
Don Oscar Danilo is married. His family consists of his wife and four children. He has 11 years of experience as a result of working with his father who was in the same trade. Oscar currently has his own furniture workshop where he produces all kinds of products such as bedroom sets, cabinets, doors, multi-purpose furniture, dining sets, and other pieces so that he will have a wide variety to offer to his customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cedar wood, sealant, avocado wood, sandpaper, adhesive, and gallons of paint. He came to CEPRODEL in order to request a new loan so that he could restock his business with basic supplies.

loans.use: to buy cedar wood, sealant, avocado wood, sandpaper, adhesive, and gallons of paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy dairy products like milk by the case, milk in cartons, and yogurt.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Fatuma operates an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to add M-pesa float (electronic stored-value credits) for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (electronic stored-value credits for mobile money transfers) for her business.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 51 years old. She lives in Abasha District, West Georgia with her family: her husband, Bessarion, and her 27-year-old son and daughter-in-law. Dali works as a cashier in a local company. Along with her main job, Dali is actively involved in the family agricultural business. 

They have seven milk cows. Dali and Bessarion produce and sell on average 60 kg of cheese per month on the local market. Along with the above mentioned, the family runs a small pig farm with two pigs. They sell on average 15 piglets per year. Also Bessarion and his son grow maize and melons on a family-owned 1.5 hectare plot of land. Part of the harvested corn is used for feeding the domestic animals and the rest (approximately 1 ton) is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Dali requested credit for tilling the land and purchasing melon seeds. After properly done seasonal work, the family will get a good harvest of melons and sell it on the local market. According to Dali’s estimations, the family will get a profit of 1,700 Laris. She plans to use it for renovation of part of the house, as it is old and needs some repair.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase melon seeds.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha lives in Abasha District, West Georgia with his wife, Nana, and two sons (12 and 3 years old). Gocha is a car repairer. He has his own workshop, where he provides car repair services to the local population. The average monthly profit of the workshop is 500 Laris. Nana is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have four milk cows. Nana produces and sells 60 kg of traditional Georgian cheese at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 950 Laris.

Gocha requested a loan for purchasing electronic lifting equipment to lift the cars when necessary. With the assistance of the above-mentioned equipment, Gocha will be able to diversify the services he provides and attract new customers. It will have a positive impact on his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for lifting cars for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a single woman with seven children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and clothing. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a café business, where she earns her income. Mwanamgeni faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is 51 years old. He lives in a small village of the Vani District with his family: his wife Nato and two sons (23 and 14 years old). The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a milk cow and a calf. Nato produces and sells on average 20 kg of cheese per month. Also they grow melons and maize on  1.5 hectares of family-owned land. Yuri sells the harvest to local retailers. Yuri's son serves in the country's army. The total average monthly income of the family is 950 Laris. 

Yuri requested credit for renting a tractor to till their land. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for purchasing melon seeds. Yuri will sow maize and melon on the plot. They will work hard on the plot during spring to get a good harvest in the summer. Yuri will sell harvested products through known distribution channels. He plans to reinvest his profits for further development of the family farm.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land and to purchase melon seeds

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es: La Sra. Oliva  casada con cinco hijos mayores de edad se dedica a su negocio como es la compra de plátanos al por mayor desde hace diez años su actividad económica la realiza en el mercado central de la localidad lo cual tiene clientela fina y eventuales lo que le permite mantener la rentabilidad de su negocio a través del financiamiento que Fundación León 2000 le ha brindado para ampliar la producción  de plátanos  y venderla a su clientelas,   a través de este negocio ha cumplido metas y personales como es las mejoras de su negocio y hacerle mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en: Sra. Oliva is married and has five grown children.  She has a business in which she has been buying bananas wholesale for 10 years.  Oliva conducts her business at the central market in her town.  She has a good set of casual customers, which allows her to maintain a profitable business.  With the loans from Fundación León 2000, she has been able to increase her inventory of bananas that she sells to her customers.  As a result of working in her business, she has been able to accomplish her personal goals such as improving her business and making renovations to her home.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is sixty years old. He lives in a small village in Samtredia District with his wife, Guliko, two sons aged 32 and 33 years old, and two daughters-in-law. There are also four grandchildren: two are four years old, one is three and the youngest is one.

The family has a farm. They have two milk cows and a calf. Guliko makes cheese and sells on average twenty kgs. at the local market. The family also has 2.5 hectares of land upon which melons, maize, tomatoes, cucumbers and eggplant are grown. They sell their harvest also at the local open market. The family’s total average monthly income is 750 GEL.

Eldar has requested a 1,000 GEL loan from LLC to rent a tractor to cultivate his land and buy melon and maize seed to sow. With proper care of their crops, the family will get a good harvest and sell it for a good price.

Eldar and Guliko will use their increased income to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and buy melon and maize seed to sow.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 and the mother of three children aged between five and nine years. She sells a variety of foodstuffs such as beans, potatoes, rice and sugar.

Jacqueline has requested a 500,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more potatoes, beans, and rice to sell. She will reinvest her increased profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, beans, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business; her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours.  

With the 10,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She dreams of establishing her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sokiri

texts.en:
Sokiri is a 26-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of three and one year old.  None of them goes to school. 

Sokiri runs a mixed goods store business and has been in the business for four years. He has one employee. Sokiri heard about Finance Sudan on the radio and through promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like utensils, bags, earrings, cosmetics and many other items. In addition to this business, Sokiri has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Sokiri hopes to build a house and increase the business size as well. 

His major challenges include the low income rate and higher transportation costs of the goods because most of his goods come from the neighboring nation.

Sokiri says that he appreciates Finance Sudan for supporting the poor but active with financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more items like utensils, bags, earrings, cosmetics and many other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yucca wood, fertilizers, and supplies.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is requesting another Kiva loan. The previous loan enabled him to repair his cafe and purchase food stall items. The loan also enabled him to make enough in profits to continue educating his children.

Katana is now asking for 40,000 KES to further boost his business. With the loan he will purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and sacks of rice and beans for his food stall.

loans.use: purchase more for groceries for his food stall.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has four children aged 13, 8, 7, and 2. In 2002, Abu Bakarr established a business selling freezers, DVDs, home theatre equipment, generators, coolman, megaphones, TVs, spray, etc. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,900,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abu Bakarr requires a loan in order to buy ten televisions for 500,000 SLL each. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to become an international businessman, provide quality education for his children, and get a car. This loan will increase his stock and maximize his profits. He is fair and hardworking. God willing Abu Bakarr will pay his loan as scheduled. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ten televisions for resale

loans.name: Demur

texts.en:
Demur is sixty-five years old. He lives in Samtredia District. Demur lives alone. He earns a living through his agricultural business. In particular, he has a milk cow. Demur produces and sells on average 20 kg of cheese per month. Also he grows maize on 2 hectares land, one of which is his own and the other one is rented. He sells harvested maize on the local market. Along with the above mentioned Demur owns a tractor. He provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and earns 1,500 Laris per year. Demur’s total average monthly income is 800 Laris. 

Demur requested credit for to renovate the tractor. After the renovation its capacity will increase and Demur will be able to carry out more orders. Demur’s income will increase. He will purchase additional household goods to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay to renovate his tractor.

loans.name: Mickey

texts.en: Mickey lives in Air Port Community. She is thirty-eight years old, married, and has twelve children between one and nineteen. Six are in school and all of them live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past fifteen years, she been selling palm oil. She started this business through her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. She learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes it because it makes her busy and popular. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Mwanajuma has operated a palm wine selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. Her major goal is to educate her children. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase building materials and timber. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and timber.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a widowed woman, with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food market business, selling sweet potatoes and groundnuts. She sells from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sweet potatoes and ground nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sweet potatoes and ground nuts.

loans.name: Manuel David

texts.es: Manuel David de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de mariscos camarones, pescado, conchas entre otros, tiene mucha experiencia en este ámbito, él mismo hace sus trampas para pescar, es muy buen pescador y muy conocido en la zona, pues todo lo que pesca es de primera calidad, fresco y lo vende a precios bajos; Manuel es un hombre trabajador se levanta desde muy temprano a empezar su labor para atrapar los mejores pescados, en ocasiones la actividad la hace en la noche y nos cuenta David que en ocasiones ese  es el mejor horario para su labor, él quiere hacer crecer su negocio y en esta temporada de pesca quiere aprovechar para aumentar sus ganancias y no decepcionar a la clientela con la que ya cuenta; su mayor reto es llegar al éxito y alcanzar sus sueños ,por eso la constancia es su más  grande secreto, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita invertir en comprar a otros pescadores mariscos como camarones, pescado, conchas, calamar y pulpo y así revenderlos a los negocios cercanos al mar, intentando explorar un nuevo mercado de clientes. Manuel David tiene la confianza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica de ésta forma.
texts.en:
Manuel David is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their children. He sells seafood such as shrimp, fish, shellfish, and other items. Manuel has plenty of experience in this field. He makes his own traps that he uses for his job. Manuel is a good fisherman and is well-known in the area because the fish that he catches is of high quality, fresh, and sold at low prices. He is a hardworking gentleman who wakes up very early each morning to do his job of catching the best fish. Occasionally he will work at night since he says that is the best time to fish.

Manuel wants to grow his business. He wants to take advantage of this fishing season to increase his earnings and not disappoint his existing customers. His greatest challenge is to become successful and fulfill his dreams. He believes consistency is his greatest secret. Manuel decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy seafood from other fishermen such as shrimp, fish, shellfish, squid, and octopus that he can sell to other seaside businesses. He intends to explore this new market of customers. Manuel David is confident that he can provide financial security for his household.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, shellfish, squid, and octopus.

loans.name: Eusebio Cristino

texts.es: El señor Eusebio , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual , es comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que ellos son de muy escasos recursos y no tienen una casita digna , ya que donde habita actualmente es de plástico y tablas muy deterioradas , don Eusebio desde hace varios años es agricultor especialmente cultiva piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue la pérdida del fertilizante ya que fue estafado en la tienda , dándole fertilizantes y arena revuelta lo que el aplico al cultivo y este no tuvo cosecha de calidad por la falta insumos .El préstamo lo quiere para darle mantenimiento al cultivo y comprar nuevamente fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en:
Eusebio lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who earns a living selling fruits and vegetables, to help with the household expenses. the plans his family has are to improve their quality of life, because currently their family is very poor and do not have a decent home. Their current house is made of plastic and wooden boards that are very deteriorated. 

Eusebio has been working as a farmer for many years, specifically in the cultivation of pineapple. The thing he is struggling with most right now is the loss of fertilizer. He was cheated by the store who sold it to him, giving him fertilizer mixed with sand. He applied it to his crop, and because it lacked quality fertilizers he did not have a good harvest. The loan he is requesting will be used to provide maintenance to his crops, to buy new fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Santos

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es una mujer casada y con dos hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en caserío La Rita del distrito de Tambogrande. Deysi vive en la parte  urbana de este distrito y cuenta con servicios básicos como luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Deysi es la venta de productos de belleza, también vende productos naturales; También se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral. Ella cuenta con clientela ya establecida, lo cual le ha  permitido tener  un crecimiento  sólido de su negocio en la venta de productos naturales, ambas actividades la desarrolla hace 4 años, teniendo ya experiencia en el trato con sus clientes.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza y  de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 32, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own house in the La Rita settlement in the Tambogrande district.  She lives in the urban part of this district, and she has the basic services like electricity.

Deyse sells beauty products and natural products.  She also raises sheep and poultry.  She has an established clientele, which has allowed her to have solid growth in her business of selling natural products.  She has been doing both business activities for four years.  She has experience in how to treat her customers.

She is requesting 2,000 soles to buy merchandise.  She will buy beauty products and natural products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.  She will buy beauty products and natural products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with six children and all her children are in school. She doesn‘t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling food and has been doing this for five years. She sells to all categories of people but on retail and works six days a week. 

She wants to use this loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy  more bags of sweet potatoes, cassava and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only and also start growing food stuffs like cassava and sweet potatoes. 

She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in Air Port Community. She is thirty-five years old, married, and has four children between two and eighteen. Three are in school and all of them live at home. For the past four years she  has been involved in local soap making. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en: Dorina is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to pay school fees. With the loan, she wants to pay school fees for her school-going child. With the previous loan, she was able to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Chokhatauri District, West Georgia with her seventeen-year-old nephew. She is sixty-eight years old and works as a teacher in a local school. Along with her main job, Tamara is busy with family agriculture. She and her nephew have three milk cows. Tamara produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of this product to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above mentioned they own 0.4 hectares of land, where maize is grown. Tamara uses the maize to feed the cows and sells the surplus locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Tamara requested credit to renovate the house. Her house is already old and needs renovation. After the make-over the house will become more comfortable and Tamara and her nephew will live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for renovations on her house.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene cinco hijos, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la ventanilla Los Girasoles.
Carlos Alberto se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz.
Solicita el crédito para compra de insumos como abono, urea, fertilizantes y para compra de materiales para la instalación de riego.
Con la ayuda del crédito puedo comprar materiales para instalaciones de riego.
Las compras y ventas de los productos que necesita las realiza con frecuencia en la ciudad de Quevedo.
El sueño es tener su propia empresa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguir trabajando por su negocio.
En el tiempo libre se dedica hacer deporte.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is 43 years old. He is married with five children. He lives with his wife in the rural area of Ventanas, which is a part of the province of Los Rios. He is a member of the communal bank Los Girasoles (The Sunflowers). Carlos Alberto makes a living as a farmer, planting corn. He has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer, urea, chemical fertilizers and to buy supplies to put in irrigation. He makes purchases and sales frequently, which he does in the city of Quevedo. His dream is to have his own business. The challenges he faces include finding a way to continue working in his business. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizer, urea, chemical fertilizers and to buy supplies to put in irrigation.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah lives in Airport community. She is married and has four children between the ages of twenty-five and thirty. One lives at home and is presently in school, while the oldest ones are working and living on their own. 

For the past fifteen years she has been selling lappers (traditional cloth). She makes good profits because her business is in a very good location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is thirty-three years old. He lives in a small village of Abasha District with his family: his wife – Eka, his three-year-old daughter, his retired parents and his younger brother. Eka works as a saleslady in a village store. She gets a monthly salary. Vakhtang works as assistant driver on a mini-bus, which connects two towns of West Georgia. He spends most of the daytime on his bus route. Vakhtang’s parents and brother are involved in the family agricultural business: They have three milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold on the local open market. Along with the above mentioned the family has a wooden greenhouse. 

Vakhtang requested credit to cultivate the land and purchase polyethylene for the greenhouse. He will grow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens during the whole year in the greenhouse. As a result of the above mentioned the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.ru:
Расель – лидер группы «Береке», замужем, воспитывает 2 детей.  Расель занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки телки.  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы и 7 коз и получая прибыль в сумме около 6,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов, Расель намерена и далее развивать животноводство.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Расель обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Расель планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Rasel is the leader of the "Bereke" group, married and raising two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business with a purchase of one cow.  Having two dairy cows and seven goats in her business and making a profit of about 6,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products, Rasel intends to continue developing her animal husbandry business.  In order to further grow her business, Rasel requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a dairy cow.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар – участник группы «Береке», вдова. Анар занимается животноводством, имеет в хозяйстве 1 бычка и 3,5 га земли, где выращивает клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Anar is a participant of the "Bereke" group and a widow.  She is involved in animal husbandry and has one bull and 3.5 hectares of land, where she grows clover.  In order to further develop her business, Anar requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy mineral fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia tiene 25 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformado por 10 miembros.
Ana Lucia se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, arveja, frejol.
Solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima como semillas de frejol e insumos necesarios como abono 2qq, urea 1qq.
Con la ayuda del crédito podre incrementar las cosechas gracias a los abonos y fertilizantes.
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada quince días.
 El sueño es tener más sembríos de frejol que le permita tener ingresos mas altos con el resultado de la producción podemos tener comodidad en nuestro hogar.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son  las vías en mal estado y perdida de las cosechas por muchas lluvias (mal clima).
En el tiempo libre le gusta relajarse, descansar para poder recuperar fuerzas.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Balacelo", which consists of 10 members.

Ana Lucia is a farmer who grows corn, peas, and beans. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase bean seeds and necessary supplies for her crops, such as two quintals of compost (1 quintal = 46 kg) and one quintal of urea. With the help of this loan, she will be able to increase her harvest as a result of acquiring composts and fertilizers. Her purchases and sales are conducted on a regular basis in the canton of Chillanes every 15 days.

Ana Lucia's dream is to increase her planting of beans so that she can produce more, increase her income, and live comfortably at home. The challenges she faces include the roads that are in bad condition and the risk of crop loss resulting from an abundance of rain.

In her free time, Ana Lucia likes to rest and relax so that she can regain her strength.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and urea.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon equipment and finish building her house.

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Tahyatu, who is in her mid thirties, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a charcoal and local chicken business for two years now.  She works from 7.00 am to 9.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the business and has paid back her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to further increase the business stock. Her dream is to one day be able to open a Genge-Duka.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tamalinda" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and local chicken to resell.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль – участник группы «Береке», замужем, воспитывает 2 детей.  Айгуль занимается животноводством, имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы, 3 бычка, 20 овец и 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Aigul is a participant of the "Bereke" group, married and raising two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and has two dairy cows, three bulls, twenty sheep and three horses in her business.  In order to further develop her business, Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a dairy cow.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 61 años de edad, vive en un barrio  muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá está acompañado con la señora Maria de 52 años de edad, no tienen  hijos, pero les hubiese gustado tenerlos.
El señor José es taxista de profesión, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 15 años, su esposa lo ayuda en la casa. Ella se encarga también de atender la pequeña despensa que tienen en su casa. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora que lucha siempre lucha por ser mejor cada día y sobresalir.
El solicita el crédito para hacer un mantenimiento a su taxi, ya que lo necesita, pues es su único medio de trabajo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, y dice que no la desperdiciará
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is 61 years old and lives in a neighborhood that is close to the central part of the city of Itá. He is married to Sra. Maria, age 52. They do not have children, but they wish they were able to have them. Sr. Jose is a taxi driver by profession and has been in business for more than 15 years. His wife helps around the house. She also manages a small food pantry out of their home.

Jose defines himself as a hardworking individual who strives to get better each day so that he can succeed. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for needed maintenance to his taxi since this is his only source of work. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received and he says that he intends not to let it go to waste.

loans.use: to pay for taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 40 years old. He lives in Abasha District, West Georgia with his family: his wife Dariko, two sons (21 and 20 years old) and his parents (retired). 

Temur sells fruits and vegetables. He purchases fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and takes them for resale to neighboring towns with his own mini-bus. Along with the aforementioned, Temur owns a tractor. He provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1400 lari.

Temur requested credit for purchasing fruits and vegetables for resale. He will increase the assortment of products and the sales will increase. The income of the family will increase. Temur plans to make some savings in the future to renovate the house and purchase furniture, in order to make their life in the village more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan lives in Malindi, Kenya. He owns rental houses; a business that has been running for the last four years. Besides this business, Duncan also makes roofing materials for his clients. The roofing materials are made from coconut leaves and provide cool roofing especially in the sunny Coastal area. Duncan started the construction of the rental buildings from his savings.

He learned of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to renovate the houses. Duncan intends to save the income and use it to construct other houses in the future. His challenge is some clients not paying the rent on time.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Danny José

texts.es: El señor  Danny José, de oficio comerciante, su negocio consisten en compra y venta de todo tipo de calzado de segunda tiene en el mercado 6 años, antes el trabajaba como comerciante de calzados nuevos, pero ahora  miro mas favorable este tipo de comercio. Sus ventas las realiza en el mercado de Jinotepe. Sus ventas son de contado, trabaja en conjunto con su esposa ya que entre los dos han sacado adelante su negocio. Se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un crédito para la compra de zapatos de dama, zapatos mixtos, y de niños. Y así poder abastecer la  demanda, y de igual manera tener nueva mercadería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Danny José is a merchant whose business consists of buying and selling secondhand shoes. He has been in the marketplace for six years. Danny previously sold new shoes, but he now sees that this type of business is more favorable. His sales are conducted at the market in Jinotepe on a cash basis. He and his wife work together and the two of them are able to move their business forward.

Danny came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan in order to buy women's shoes, unisex shoes, and children's shoes. By having new merchandise to offer to his customers, he will be able to keep up with demand.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes, unisex shoes, and children's shoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a business lady living in Likoni, Kenya. She owns a salon which she started one year ago. Lilian is also a married mother of two children. She started the business from her savings. 

Lilian learnt of Milango from friends. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products e.g. hair, shampoo etc. Her aspiration is to grow the business and be able to meet the needs of her family. The challenges Lilian faces in this business are high cost of equipment and the seasonal business climate.

Despite all these, she believes her family will have savings from the additional income from this loan for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase salon products such as hair and shampoo.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. Sylvester runs a food café; the business has been in operation for one year. As usual, Kongowea receives high number of customers who come to purchase items from this large open air market. Sylvester is also employed in the hotel industry.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase stocks of food for the business. The challenge his business faces is high competition from established businesses. 

Sylvester believes this business will improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of food for the business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth de 43 años vive en la linda e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 12 años. Allí tiene varios negocios, por un lado vende perfumería y productos cosméticos en general  y su otra actividad productiva es la venta de gallina, cerdo, pescados y carne de res.
