Ruth desde niña ha tenido el negocio como su vocación principal, pues en la escuela aun recuerda, que era “pilosa” (como ella misma lo dice), pues vendía fantasías económicas a sus compañeras de clases, llevaba al colegio binchas, aretes, pulseras etc. con las que le ganaba algo de dinero. En su mente siempre ha estado “el ser independiente” generando sus propios ingresos, por eso continuó con su actividad comercial cuando terminó de estudiar en la escuela. Ella para invertir, preguntaba a sus posibles clientes lo que necesitaban y así mismo compraba esa mercancía y la ofrecía,  para que estos se la pagaran en cuotas pactadas. En la actualidad apoya el sustento de su familia, vendiendo directamente lo que compra a proveedores en el centro de la ciudad y también mediante guías especializadas de productos.  Así mismo toma pedidos de carnes, gallina, cerdo y vende en su propia residencia,  entre vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos. Con este último negocio le ha ido muy bien y desea ampliarlo, porque cada día crece su clientela. Esta es una de las razones por las cuales acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una parte en carne, gallina, cerdo y pescado en mayor volumen y la otra parte la invertirá en perfumes, cremas y productos de belleza, que llegaron en su catalogo con buenos descuentos, los cuales aprovechará para trasladarle los mejores precios a sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante en invertir en vitrinas, adecuar su espacio locativo, con el fin de ofrecer mejores precios, mejores productos y aumentar su clientela y con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 43 years old and lives in the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and 2 children (ages 10 and 12).  She has several businesses there, including one business in which she sells perfumes and general cosmetics, and another business where she sells chicken, pork, fish, and beef.  

Ever since Ruth was a little girl business has been her main calling in life.  Even though she admits it was a long time ago, she can still remember that in school she used to sell her classmates costume jewelry; she would bring hair bands, earrings, bracelets, and other items to school and then sell them to her classmates.  Ruth’s goal was always to be independent and generate her own income, and so she continued with her business activities after she finished her studies.  She would ask potential customers what they needed and then would purchase those items and sell them; her customers would pay her in agreed-upon installments.  

Ruth’s business currently helps support her family.  She sells products that she purchases from suppliers in the city center, along with items that she buys from special product catalogs.  She also takes orders for beef, chicken and pork from friends, family, neighbors, and referrals and sells the meat at her home.  Her meat business has gone very well and she wants to expand it, since her customer base grows by the day.  

That is one of the reasons why Ruth has decided to take out a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will use some of it to purchase beef, chicken, pork, and fish in larger quantities.  She will use the rest of it to invest in perfume, creams, and other beauty products, which she will purchase with discounts from a catalog—that way she can transfer the best prices to her customers.  

Ruth’s plan for the future is to invest in display cases and adapt the retail space that she leases.  This will allow her to offer better prices and products and expand her clientele, and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, pork, and fish in larger quantities, and to invest in perfume, creams, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La señora Noemí nació en la ciudad del Cusco – Perú, ahora tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella.

Su actividad económica principal es la comercialización de artículos de ferretería tales como pinturas, cemento, y todo lo referente a materiales y accesorios de construcción.

Ella trabaja todos los días en su comercio ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián de la ciudad del Cusco, la apoyan sus hijos en el negocio familiar y para ellos es el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad La Señora Noemí necesita hacer un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y surtir su negocio, ya que la competencia en este sector comercial de la ciudad se ha incrementado.

La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco comunal “San Rafael” de la Ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Senora Noemi was born in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is 52 years old and married with 4 children.   Noemi works selling hardware supplies for construction.  She works every day in her shop located in the district of San Sebastian in Cusco.  Her children help her with the family business,  Noemi will use her portion of this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her store. She is already experienced in this work and her business has grown.   Noemi is a member of the communal bank "San Rafael", in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Vangelen

texts.en:
Vangelen is a married woman with three children. She is forty-two years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Vangelen owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,524 to purchase farm chemicals. Brenda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Vangelen's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house and a lot.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel a thirty-eight-year old, is a married mom. She lives in Misamis Occidental. She has three children with her husband who is a bank messenger. Thus, she has to do her best to give her children a good future. She manages their flower business, and gets an income of PHP 3,100 each month from it. 

She wants to borrow PHP 5,758 from GDMPC to buy fertilizer so she can increase her production of flowers. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She hopes to be able to achieve her dream which is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is thirty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Valentina has a shop that sells accessories and toys. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of accessories and toys to sell like pony tails, head bands, stickers, key chains, barbie dolls and hair clips.

Valentina became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Valentina hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of accessories and toys to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who has four children. Anita is fifty-two years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Anita owns and operates a farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for twelve years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 9,500 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC. In the future, Anita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Desde los 7 años Jesús aprendió a trabajar con su padre en las fincas de café cosechando y a los 25 años se casó con Reyna y comenzó a producir su propio café. Él y su esposa tienen 6 hijos los cuales los ayudan en el trabajo de siembra y cosecha en sus terrenos. Durante las épocas de menor trabajo para el café él y su familia se dedican a la ganadería y a producir limón y caña para mejorar sus ingresos. Durante la última cosecha Jesús entregó 8 toneladas a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que posteriormente fuera exportada.
Jesús quiere para la próxima cosecha aumentar su producción de 8 a 11 toneladas, así como convertir todo su café de convencional a orgánico y es por esto que el necesita un crédito que invertirá en sus cafetales.
Entre otros proyectos que él tiene a futuro está el de poner un local comercial en su vivienda la cual se encuentra ubicada en un lugar por donde pasan muchos automóviles.
texts.en:
Since the age of 7, Jesús learned how to work with his father in coffee plantations and at the age of 25 he married Reyna and started producing his own coffee.  He and his wife have six children who help with the planting and harvesting on his land.  During seasons of less coffee work, he and his family raise livestock and grow lemons and sugarcane to improve their income.  During the last harvest, Jesús delivered 8 tons to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative] to be subsequently exported.

Jesús wants to increase his next harvest from 8 tons to 11 tons as well as to switch his entire production to organic coffee and this is why he needs a loan to invest in his coffee plants.

Among other projects he has for the future is to set up a store at home which is well located because it’s in a spot where many cars pass by.

loans.use: Aumentar su producción y cambiar de café convencional a orgánico

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vecino de la localidad de Huatusco,cuenta con 60 años de edad vive con su esposa, su hija y un nieto, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación primaria a la edad de los 12 años aprendió el oficio del café quien fue enseñado por su padre, actualmente es productor de café convencional y su única activada laboral y sustento es el cultivo de café el tiene la meta de aumentar su producción e ir renovando su finca por eso pide un crédito para la compra de abono, plantas y para el pago de las personas que le apoyaran en el mejoramiento de la misma, nos comenta también que en futuro le gustaría ser productor de caña de azúcar. 
Y con las mejoras realizadas y ganancias que esto genere el quiere apoyar a su nieto para que termine una educación universitaria y poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en: Julio lives in Huatusco.  He’s 60 years old and lives with his wife, a daughter and a grandson.  He studied up to second grade in elementary school.  At the age of 12 he learned the occupation of coffee having been taught by his father.  He’s currently a conventional coffee grower and his only source of work and support is growing coffee.  His goal is to increase production and to renew his farm so is asking for a loan to buy manure and plants and to pay people who will help him improve it.  He comments also that in the future he’d like to be a sugarcane producer.  With the improvements done and with profits they generate he wants to help his grandson complete a university education and to be able to remodel his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plot of land and as a result it will be more productive; he will also use it to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro tiene 48 años y desde 1991 se dedica a la producción de café junto con su esposa Victoria. Ellos tienen 4 hijos que también los ayudan a llevar a cabo esta actividad y durante las épocas en que hay más trabajo contratan gente para poder cosechar toda su producción la cual actualmente es de 12 toneladas anuales. Él produce tanto café orgánico como convencional, sin embargo le gustaría que toda su producción fuera de café orgánico pues tiene más valor en el mercado. Casimiro necesita un crédito comprar una chapeadora para poder limpiar mejor sus terrenos y comprar planta de café para sembrar y de esta manera aumentar su producción y calidad. También le gustaría adquirir una camioneta para que le sea más fácil transportar su café a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que es donde entrega toda su producción.
Él desea que todos sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria para que tengan en el futuro un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Casimiro, 48, has been growing coffee with his wife, Victoria, since 1991.  They have four children who also help carry out this activity and during the times when there is even more work to be done they hire people in order to be able to bring in the entire harvest which is currently 12 tons yearly.  He produces both conventional and organic coffee.  However, he’d like it if the entire production were organic because it has a higher market value.

Casimiro needs a loan to buy a weeder to be able to clear his fields and to buy coffee plants to plant thus increasing production and quality.  He’d also like to buy a pick-up truck so that transporting his coffee to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative] which is where he delivers his entire harvest would be easier.  He hopes that all his children will have the opportunity of studying a university career so that they will have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy a brush cutter and coffee plants.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Desde hace 40 años Candelario comenzó a trabajar en los cultivos de café con su padre. Actualmente él tiene 52 años y junto con su esposa han trabajado muy duro para continuar produciendo café de calidad, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Él tiene 6 hijos a los cuales les ha inculcado el amor por el campo y lo ayudan a trabajar en las fincas en las labores de siembra y cosecha. El último año Candelario tuvo una producción de 4 toneladas la cual entregó a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” y le gustaría que en el siguiente año su producción fuera mayor, por lo que necesita un crédito para comprar abono para sus tierras y de esta manera de mayores y mejores granos de café. Además del café Candelario también se dedica en menor medida a la producción de maíz que le sirve como ingreso extra y también lo utilizan para consumo familiar. Para él es muy importante su familia ya que son quienes lo apoyan en su trabajo y le gustaría hacerle unas mejoras a su casa para que ellos estén más cómodos.
texts.en:
Candelario started working growing coffee with his father 40 years ago. He’s currently 52 years old and together with his wife works very hard to continue producing quality coffee which is his main source of income.  He has six children he’s instilled the love of the land into and they help him work in the field during planting and harvesting seasons.  Last year Candelario obtained a production of 4 tons that he delivered to “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative] and he’d like next years’ production to be greater which is why he needs a loan to buy manure for his land so that it will yield better and more coffee beans. 

Besides coffee Candelario also works to a lesser degree growing corn which produces extra income; it’s also used for home consumption.  For him, family is very important because they are his support at work and he’d like to make some improvements to the house so that they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: compra de fertilizantes para aumentar su producción

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y dos nietos ya que al fallecer su hija,madre de los niños ella se hizo cargo delos mismos, María cuenta con 47 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café ya que desde muy pequeña su padre le enseño los cuidados y manejos del mismo, se siente muy orgullosa de las satisfacciones que le han dado sus hijos por ser buenos productores de café ya que ella les enseño el oficio.
María trabaja en su parcela la mayor parte del tiempo y en sus ratos libre cuida de sus nietos y vende productos de belleza lo cual le genera una pequeña ganancia extra su mayor ilusión es poder mandar a sus nietos a la escuela y terminen una carrera universitaria. Su meta como productora es mejorar y renovar su parcela para que aumente su producción por hectárea ya que asegura que con las mejoras que planea implementar obtendrá mayor producción y por lo consiguiente mayores ganancias económicas que le ayudaran a cumplir sus ilusiones, para lograr su objetivo pide un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y planta para reforestar parte de su finca y el pago de jornales.
texts.en:
María, 56, lives in her own house with her husband and two grandchildren.  When her daughter, the mother of these children, died she took charge of them.  María has 47 years’ experience growing coffee since her father taught her how to care and manage the crops when she was very little.  She feels very proud of the satisfaction her children have given her by being good coffee producers since she taught them the occupation.

María works in her field most of the time and in her free time takes care of her grandchildren and sells beauty products which generates a little extra income.  Her greatest hope is to be able to send her grandchildren to school and that they complete a university education.

Her goal as a grower is to improve and renovate her parcel so that production per hectare will increase because she assures that with the improvements she’s planning to implement she will obtain larger harvests and as a result higher profits that will help her reach her dreams to attain her objective.  She’s asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and coffee plants to restock part of her farm and to pay day laborers.

loans.use: comprar planta de café para renovar su parcela

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a poultry farmer living in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He started the business three years ago. Joel says he started with fifty birds but has seen his business grow tremendously; the number of poultry is now averaging one hundred and fifty birds. It is a feat he believes has been achieved through hard work and determination.

Joel is applying for a loan of 47,100 Kenya shillings to purchase poultry feed. He believes that in the next five years, his business will have enough cash flow to run without the need of loans. 

At the moment, the business faces the challenge of the high cost of materials/stock and a seasonal business climate. He sees this as a great opportunity to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a businessman living Changamwe, Kenya. He owns rental houses within the area. Moses is a married father of two children and has been operating the business for six years. He started by building sets of two rooms using mud-walled facilities from the funds he had saved from his employment. 

Moses is applying for a loan of KES 83,500 to renovate the premises of his rental houses and build other houses. His future ambition is to build more houses and also open a "posho"/maize milling machine. This is in the backdrop of some of his clients not paying the rent on time.

Moses intends to save the anticipated future additional income from this business to purchase a motorcycle; this has proved a good source of income to many area people since they can penetrate through the alleys and bad roads.

loans.use: To renovate the premises of rental houses and build other houses.

loans.name: 3.14. 152.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm is thirty-five years old and she is married with two children. Lâm is the group leader of the 3.14. 152.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has two dependents

Mrs. Lâm has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothes and repair clothes. Lâm has been involved in this business for five years.

This is Lâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Lâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lâm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothes and repair clothes.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
For over ten years in Silanga, Tangub City, Bernadeth, a forty-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a furniture making business. She earns PHP 2,500 a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Bernadeth joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 4,935 to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is forty-nine years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Nestor has a shop that sells sea food such as fish, sea shells and sea weed. He has had this business for eleven years. He requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell like sardines, milk fish and flying fish.

Nestor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nestor hopes to improve his business for the sake of his children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell like dalagang bukid, sap-sap and tamban.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира женщина,в возрасте 37 лет,замужем за Алижона.На иждивении имеет троих детей,проживает в сельской местности.Она учительница в школе и очень любит свою профессию.А муж маляр. Но у них есть и другой бизнес который приносит хороший доход,она с мужем занимается  откормом  крупно рогатого скота.Дома у нее есть 2  коровы и 2  телят. Она работает не покладая рук и сумела развить свой бизнес. Уже 4 года она кредитуется в нашей организации и доказала свою добросовестность и пунктуальность.С целью расширения бизнеса она хочет получить кредит в размере 1500 долларов и закупить 3 голов бычка.Мохира надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mohira is a 37 year-old woman, who is married to Alijon.  She has three children and lives in a rural area.  She is a school teacher and loves her work very much.  Her husband is a painter.  They also have another business that brings in a good income: Mohira and her husband are involved in fattening up cattle.  They have two cows and two calves at home.  Mohira works without rest and was able to develop her business.  She has been obtaining financing from our organization for four years and proved her conscientiousness and punctuality.  In order to expand her business, Mohira wants to obtain a loan in the amount of $1,500 and purchase three bulls.  Mohira relies on your help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Feladilfa

texts.en:
Feladilfa a fifty-year-old is a married mom living in Molicay, Misamis Occidental. She looks after her three children with her flower business which gives her an income of PHP 6,100 a month. She does her best to give a good future to her children. 

Feladilfa is borrowing PHP 11,824 from GDMPC to buy fertilizer to increase production. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She hopes that she will be able to achieve her dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Jovenal

texts.en:
Jovenal is forty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jovenal has a shop that sells snacks, viands and meat. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy meat, rice for rice cakes, fresh vegetables like green leafy vegetables, squash, radish and carrots.

Jovenal became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Jovenal hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to use for making snacks such as rice cakes, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is forty-three years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Jimmy owns and operates a business raising fish. He is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Jimmy has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 6,968 a month.

In 2007, Jimmy joined GDMPC. Jimmy is now requesting a loan of PHP 2,756 which will be used to buy materials to repair fishing nets. He plans to use any additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair fishing nets.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Alma has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy stock of coconuts and green and yellow bananas.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green and yellow bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is a married woman who has five children. Welyn is forty-six years old, and resides at Ozamis City, Philippines. Welyn owns and operates a farm where she plants root crops and bananas for a living. She's been in this business for five years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 9,562 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Welyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Welyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en:
Rosary is a married woman and a mother of three dependents. She is thirty-one years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City. Rosary owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income and now makes PHP 10,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for three years. 

Rosary requested a loan of PHP 16,450 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Rosary has been a good member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosary wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Alice has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Aside from that she also makes snacks and sells yellow bananas, vegetables such as bottle gourds and gumbo. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergents and beverages.

Alice has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Alice hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.ru: Равшанбек мужчина 45 лет,женат,имеет пятерых детей.Равшанбек пунктуальный,умный и ответственный человек. Он начал свой бизнес в 1993 году со стартовой суммы 250 сомони и в 2003 году с целью расширения своего бизнеса он обратился в организацию "Арванд" и уже 9 лет кредитуется в нашей организации и в течении кредитования он доказал свою честность и добросовестность и  расширил свой бизнес до 15000 сомони. По бизнесу ему помогает его жена,а его дети учатся.Он старается содержать семью в достатке. Равшанбек очень благодарен организации "Арванд" и надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ravshanbek is a 45 year-old man, who is married and has five children.  Ravshanbek is a punctual, smart and responsible person.  He started his business in 1993 with an initial sum of 250 somoni and came to the "Arvand" organization in 2003 in order to expand his business.  He has been obtaining financing from our organization for nine years and proved his honesty and conscientiousness, and expanded his business to 15000 somoni.  His wife helps him with the business, and children attend a school.  He tries to provide well for his family.  Ravshanbek is very grateful to the "Arvand" organization and relies on your help and support.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a sus hijos , uno de los mayores le apoya con los trabajos del campos , ya que ella desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cítricos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder plantar veinte mil plantas de limones ,  doña Rosa se encuentra en una situación muy difícil ya que no tiene los suficientes recursos económicos para poder darle mantenimiento a una manzana de cítricos y se encuentra desesperada ya que es el único recurso con el que cuenta para poder sobrevivir ya que lo que sacan del cultivo lo vende y de eso viven. Agradece el apoyo y confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos kiva para poder seguir trabajando honradamente.
texts.en: Rosa lives in the municipality of Concepcion, together with her children.  One of her older children helps her with her agricultural work. Rosa has been cultivating citrus trees for many years.  In the future, she would like to plant many more lemon trees.  Rosa's situation is very difficult as she doesn't have sufficient financial resources  to maintain the block of citrus trees, and she feels somewhat desperate as her only source of income is from the sales of this fruit.  Rosa appreciates the support and confidence that the organization Afodenic provides through Kiva, so that she can continue to work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 30-year-old married man with three children between the ages of one and seven. One of his children is enrolled in school. He is married to Salama, a businesswoman. Emmanuel operates a kiosk and a goat-meat business. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He describes seasonality to be his major challenge, and aims to expand the existing business and purchase a grinding machine in the future. He decided to join Yehu to access business loans. He intends to use the loan of 20000 KES to buy goats for resale, and has been in this business for the last 9 years.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Maria has a food retail shop, or "sari-sari" store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 30,000 to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, detergents, shampoo, bath soap, and beverages.

Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, detergent, shampoo, bath soap, and beverages

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a married woman and has 3 children. Rosalyn, 38 years old, resides at Migcanaway, Tangub City, Philippines. Rosalyn owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been 3 years in this business. 

Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,244 to purchase additional fish to sell. Rosalyn has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rosalyn wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Armenia

texts.en:
Armenia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Armenia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages. She's had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergents and beverages.
Armenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Armenia hopes to improve her business in order to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereal, shampoo, bath soap, detergents and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura is from Migcawanay, Tangub City. She is fifty-two years old. Pura is married and has six children. To make a living, Pura owns and operates a business, cultivating bananas for sale. Pura has been engaged in her business for five years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from it. 

In 2009, Pura joined GDMPC. Pura is requesting a new loan of PHP 6,786 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Meilin

texts.en:
Meilin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Meilin requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Meilin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is forty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Natividad provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy tools like a t-wrench, air compressor, screw driver and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Natividad has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Natividad hopes to improve her services so that she can ensure an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Askat

texts.ru: Аскат – участник группы «Береке», женат, воспитывает 2 дочерей и 1 сына. Аскат занимается животноводством, имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 20 овец и 2,5 га земли, где выращивает клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аскат обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку коровы.  Доходы от кредита Аскат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Askat is a participant of the "Bereke" group, married and raising two daughters and one son.  Askat is involved in animal husbandry and has three dairy cows, one horse, twenty sheep and 2.5 hectares of land, where he grows clover.  In order to further develop his business, Askat requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a cow.  He plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo  de 71 años de edad vive en casa propia,el estudio hasta segundo año de educación primaria,con el fallecimiento de su padre cuando tenia solo nueve años de edad  su abuelo paterno le enseño todo lo relacionado con el cultivo y producción del café, con el paso del tiempo y su afán por progresar como productor adquirió algunas parcelas las demás fueron heredadas por su abuelo, ya que a sido productor de café desde hace años y sabe que para que su producción aumente necesita reforestar, fertilizar y dar mantenimiento a su parcela con limpias y podas por lo cual pide un crédito para realizar labores culturales y así aumentar la producción de su parcela Don Eduardo tienen otro oficio aparte de la producción de café también aprendió a nacatear lo cual le deja algunos ingresos extras aparte de la producción de café para el es muy importante crecer como productor y aumentar su cosecha ya que todo lo que el haga ahora sera la herencia de sus hijos y nietos su mayor ilusión es poder comprar mas parcelas y construir otra casa mas grande.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 71, lives in his own house.  He studied up to second grade in elementary school.  When his father died when he was only nine years old, his paternal grandfather taught him everything related to growing coffee.  As time went by and with his desire to make progress as a grower he acquired a few parcels and the other ones were inherited from his grandfather.  He’s been a coffee grower for years and knows that in order for its production to increase he needs to reforest, fertilize and provide maintenance to his parcel by weeding it and pruning.  This is what he needs a loan for, to do the cultural tasks needed to increase production of his parcel.

Eduardo has another occupation besides coffee production.  He also learned to butcher which produces some extra income besides what he earns from the coffee.  For him, it’s very important to develop as a producer and to increase his harvests because everything he does now will be his children’s and his grandchildren’s inheritance and his greatest dream is to be able to buy more land and to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to fulfill the tasks needed to increase production including weeding and pruning.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 56 años y vive en México. Desde los 10 años ella comenzó a trabajar con el café ayudando a su padre a sembrarlo y cosecharlo. Cuando se caso ella y su esposo comenzaron a producir su propio café para venderlo y lo que ganaron lo invirtieron para ir adquiriendo nuevas tierras. Actualmente ella tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos están estudiando una carrera universitaria en Agronomía. Toda su familia esta involucrada en la producción y también venden planta de café a otros productores de la región. Dolores es socia de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” desde hace varios años y es allí a donde entrega su producción cada año para que posteriormente sea exportada.
Ella produce café convencional y por medio de un préstamo quiere hacer el cambio a café orgánico que es de mayor calidad y es mejor pagado en el mercado. En un futuro a ella y a su esposo les gustaría adquirir un terreno para iniciar junto con sus hijos un negocio de cría de borregos.
texts.en:
Dolores, 56, lives in México.  Since the age of 10 she started working with coffee helping her father plant and harvest it.  When she got married she and her husband started to produce their own coffee and what they earned they invested in buying new land.  She currently has four children two of which are studying Agronomy in the university.  All of her family is involved in the production and they also sell coffee plants to other growers in the region.  Dolores has been a member of the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” for several years and that’s where she delivers her yearly harvest for subsequent export.

She produces conventional coffee and through the loan wants to make the switch to organic coffee that’s higher quality and has a higher market price.  In the future she and her husband would like to acquire land to start a business with their children raising sheep.

loans.use: to change her conventional coffee production to organic.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
 
Elena has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages. She's had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergents, shampoo and beverages. Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business in order to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents, shampoo, bath soap and beverages.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is separated and lives with her child. Norma is 50-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and produces bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years and every month she earns PHP 3,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,318 to purchase fertilizer for the bananas.

Norma has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Norma hopes to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for bananas.

loans.name: Mariesa

texts.en:
Mariesa is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Mariesa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages. Aside from that she is also selling rice and hog feeds. She's had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages, rice, and hog feeds.

Mariesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mariesa hopes to improve her business in order to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, hog feeds, canned goods, snacks, shampoo, bath soap, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Héctor Antonio

texts.es: Héctor Antonio de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como hierro y bronce, ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, acapara gran cantidad de chatarra y espera a venderlo para obtener buen margen de ganancia tiene buena clientela pues saben que el vende todo a buenos precios además el servicio es excelente; Héctor es un hombre trabajador, muy honrado y siempre dispuesto a aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le presenta pues sabe que eso le ayudara a lograr el éxito, piensa que cuanto más duro trabaje, más grande será la recompensa, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chatarra hierro, bronce, aluminio, cobre, etc. Héctor Antonio tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Héctor Antonio, 39, lives with his life partner and their children in his own home.  He has a business buying and selling scrap metal such as iron and bronze.  He already has years of experience in this line of work.  He stockpiles a large quantity of scrap metal and hopes to sell it and obtain a good profit margin.  He has a good customer base, because they know that he sells everything at the best prices and his service is excellent.   Héctor is a hardworking and honest man who is always ready to take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself, as he knows that this will help him to be successful.  He thinks that the more he works, the bigger the payoff.  This is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy scrap iron, bronze, aluminum, copper, etc.   Héctor Antonio hopes that in this way he can provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal: iron, bronze, aluminum and copper

loans.name: Ricardo Daniel

texts.es: Ricardo Daniel vive junto a su compañera de vida en una zona muy accesible para el cultivo, él se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva Caña, maíz, frijol y maicillo, es muy conocido por toda la zona, pues debido a sus años de experiencia siempre saca las mejores cosechas de las temporadas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios bajos, además Ricardo se caracteriza por ser muy servicial y amable con sus clientes; Es un hombre trabajador y perseverante dispuesto a cumplir todos sus sueños y mantenerse firme hasta lograrlos, su más grande secreto es la constancia y la motivación, quiere que el negocio crezca es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar  semilla de maíz y frijol  de primera calidad para grano de cosecha, también fertilizantes y controles de plaga. Ricardo Daniel tiene la esperanza que al incrementar la cantidad de su cosecha mejorarán sus ingresos y por ella se esforzará mas a fin de cumplir su sueño de que su familia viva en mejores condiciones
texts.en:
Ricardo Daniel and his life companion live in an area that is suitable for crops. He is a farmer who grows sugar cane, corn, beans, and sorghum. Ricardo is well-known throughout the area because of his many years of experience and his ability to always achieve a better harvest each season. He has acquired many customers because everything he sells is of high quality and offered at a low price. In addition, Ricardo is known for being very attentive and friendly toward his customers. He is a hardworking and persevering gentleman who is willing to fulfill all of his dreams and remain steadfast until he is able to accomplish them. His greatest secret is his consistency and his motivation.

Ricardo is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy corn and bean seeds of the highest quality so that he can begin planting. He will also buy fertilizers and pest control products. Ricardo Daniel is hopeful that he can raise the quality of his harvest so that he can improve his income and be one step closer to fulfilling his dream of having his family live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizers, and pest control products.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana nació en el Cusco – Perú, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 niños de 2 y 5 años. Ella tiene un comercio de Bar Karaoke al cual se dedica hace un buen tiempo, en este negocio los clientes van a divertirse y pasar sus momentos de ocio, por la naturaleza de la actividad, esta representa un gran sacrificio, ya que el trabajo es principalmente en horas de la noche.

En esta oportunidad la señora Feliciana desea implementar su negocio, adquiriendo un equipo de sonido, el cual le permitirá dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder crecer empresarialmente.

La señora Feliciana pertenece al Banco comunal “San Rafael” de la Ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Feliciana was born in Cusco, Perú.  She is 33 years old, and she is the single mother of two children, a two year old and a five year old.

She has a Karaoke Bar business, which she has devoted herself to for some time.  In this business the customers are having fun during their leisure time.  

Because of the nature of the business, it is a big sacrifice because the work is primarily done during the night hours.

Felicia wishes to use this opportunity to set up her business with sound equipment.  This would allow her to gives her customers better service and to grow as a business woman.

Feliciana belongs to the San Rafael communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El Señor Gabriel nació en la ciudad del Cusco – Perú, ahora tiene 36 años de edad está soltero y su actividad principal es la elaboración de artesanías para la venta a los comerciantes, los cuales trabajan para el  mercado turístico.
En esta oportunidad el señor Gabriel necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en material que le permitirá producir más mercadería y así poder venderlo en la próxima temporada alta del turismo que esta a punto de comenzar.

El señor Gabriel espera con esta actividad poder ampliar su negocio, crecer empresarialmente y establecer un taller mas grande para poder trabajar de a cuerdo a la demanda.

Gabriel pertenece al Banco comunal “San Rafael” de la Ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Gabriel was born in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He is now 36 years old and single.  His main business activity is making handicrafts to sell to the merchants who work in the tourist market.

At this time Gabriel needs a loan to invest in material that will allow him to produce more merchandise.  This way he will be able to sell it during the next high tourist season, which is about to start.

Gabriel hopes that through this business activity he will be able to expand his business and grow as a businessman.  He also hopes to establish a bigger shop in order to be able to work according to the demand.

Gabriel belongs to the San Rafael communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy materials for his handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes es  soltera esta emprendedora   se ha dedicado al negocio  de venta de plásticos desde hace catorce años, actividad que la inicio con capital propio en la actualidad su negocio ha venido creciendo y de la misma forma su cliente se han incrementado sus producto gracias al buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, la rentabilidad de su negocio la ha logrado gracia al financiamiento que fundación León 2000 le ha brindado a lo largo de este tiempo por lo tanto ha logrado sus metas económicas y personal como son: la compra de un  tramo en el mercado de su localidad, compra de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes como son : bolsas plásticas de diferentes tamaños, productos desechables platos, vasos,  cucharas, tenedores que se utilizan en eventos y fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is single. This entrepreneur has been selling plastic items for 14 years. She started her business with her own capital. Currently her business has been growing, as well as her customer base, thanks to the good service she provides for her customers. 
Her business has achieved profitability thanks to the financing which Fundación León 2000 has been offering her during this time. As a consequence, she has reached her financial and personal goals, such as the purchase of a market stall in her town, and the purchase of products to satisfy her customers' demand, like plastic bags of different sizes and disposable products: plates, cups, spoons, and forks for use at events and parties.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags of different sizes and disposable products: plates, cups, spoons, and forks for use at events and parties.

loans.name: Bankito Del Quinche  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bankito Del Quinche se reúne cada quince días en el sitio Tohalla del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás  y formar este banco comunal, el cual les ha ayudado mucho ya que con el crédito que recibieron ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, ellos se dedican a varias actividades pero en su mayoría a la elaboración de ladrillos y a la agricultura.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 6, 3 y 1 año de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es operador de maquinarias.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con la finalidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y sandalias, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días ya además de salir tres veces por semana también vende en su casa, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Huaquillas o en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Ella lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos,  es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios del grupo.
 
Su sueño es que a sus pequeños no les falte nada.

La foto pèqueña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Bankito Del Quinche” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Tohalla in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts known locally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

This is a group of people who decided to join together some time ago to form this communal bank which has helped them much because with the loan they got they were able to improve their small businesses.  They carry out a variety of activities but for the most part are brick manufacturers or farmers.

Maritza, 27, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 6, 3 and 1 year old; the oldest attends school.  Her husband is a machine operator.
 
She is a great housewife who in order to earn a bit on her own to help with household expenses sells all types of clothes, shoes and sandals.  She sells door to door and also from home where she has a small store.  She works every day because aside from going out three days a week to sell she also sells from home.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She goes to Huaquillas or to Guayaquil to buy merchandise every time she needs to.  She’s been in business five years and she does very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and is the group president; she likes it because of the support and group benefits.

Her dream is that her little ones lack nothing.

The photo is of three members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Cinthia Yamileth

texts.es:
Cinthia, de 29 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Choloma, Cortes, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 2, 5 y 13 años de edad, dos  de ellos estudian en la escuela.
Cinthia, emprendió su propio negocio desde hace dos años, ella vende ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, achinería, sandalias, cosméticos y otros. Inicio esta actividad por falta de empleo y la necesidad de generar un ingreso, las ventas las realiza de acuerdo a pedidos hechos por los clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de productos e incrementar las ventas, comprara ropa nueva y cosméticos.
Con esta inversión espera obtener los ingresos necesarios del hogar y en un futuro sueña conseguir un local fijo para vender todo tipo de mercadería.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 29, lives in a neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes, with her husband and three children who are 2, 5 and 13 years old; two of them are attending school.

Cinthia started her own business two years ago.  She sells underwear, shirts, pants, low-cost knickknacks, sandals, cosmetics and others.  She started this activity because of the scarcity of jobs and the need to generate income.  The sales she makes are according to customer orders.

She’s asking for a 10000 lempira loan to stock up on merchandise and increase sales; she’ll buy new clothes and cosmetics.

With this investment she hopes to earn the income needed for her home and in the future she dreams with getting a fixed locale to sell all types of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Adabiyat

texts.ru:
Адабият 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Адабият на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с начальной суммы 17,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Адабият в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, 15 овец и 3,60 га поливной земли с клевером и зерновыми культурами. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Адабият обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Адабият планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Adabiyat is 43 years old, married and has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years, having started this business with an initial sum of 17,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Adabiyat's hard work, today her business contains two cows, fifteen sheep and 3.60 hectares of irrigated land with clover and cereal crops.  The monthly profit from sales of milk amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Adabiyat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows, which will help her to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
En el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, El señor Aquilino se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora debido a que ha sabido manejar las condiciones de su familia. Es un señor con muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad trabaja en conjunto con su esposa cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo, se dedica principalmente a la ganadería, donde posee su propio inventario ganadero con su  finca, produce leche y la saca al mercado. 
 
 Actual mente se presentó a Ceprodel  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de tres Vaquillas para la  producción de leche, esto le servirá de mucha ayuda  ya que podrá mejorar su inventario logrando así obtener mayores ingresos al igual que le permitirá crecer en su negocio , para poder vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia
texts.en:
In the municipality of Achuapa, León Department, Aquilino has stood out for being a very hardworking person who has known how to manage his family situation.  He is a man with many years’ experience in this activity. He works together with his wife and has a son in his care.  He is mostly a cattleman.  
He owns his own herd of cattle in his farm that produces milk that he sells in the market.

He came by Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy three heifers for milk production.  This will be of great help to him because he’ll be able to improve his inventory earning higher income was well as being able to grow in business to live with his family in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesús, originario de la comunidad Matapalo, Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es de oficio agricultor. Jesús le complace la confianza que MiCredito y Kiva han depositado en él pues gracias al primer préstamo logro sacar con buenos rendimientos sus siembras de tomates. Ahora el solicita este segundo préstamo para comprar insumo y pagar mano de obra para sembrar pepinos, el espera obtener una producción de muy buena calidad, color, peso , textura pues son las características requeridas por sus clientes a quienes el les vende sus hortalizas. El nos expresa que su mayor prioridad es ir mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia, darles una buena alimentación, que su hijo estudio. El desea ir ampliando sus aéreas de siembra, vender cultivos de muy buena calidad y mejorar poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Jesús is from the community of Matapalo, Pueblo Nuevo in Estelí municipality.  He’s a farmer by profession.  

Jesús is very happy with the trust MiCredito and Kiva have placed in him because thanks to his first loan he was able to obtain good results with his tomato crops.  Now, he’s asking for this second loan to buy supplies and pay labor costs to plant cucumbers.  He hopes to obtain a very good crop with respect to quality, color, weight and texture which are the characteristics required by the customers who buy his vegetables.  

He told us that his greatest priority is to improve his family’s standard of living, to give them good nourishment and that his son attend school.  He wants to expand his growing fields, to sell very good quality products and to gradually do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay labor costs to plant cucumbers.

loans.name: Begimjan

texts.ru:
Бегимжан – лидер группы «Бегимжан», замужем, воспитала 4 детей.  Бегимжан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1998 году с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS).  Имея в хозяйстве 7 дойных коров и 5 овец, и получая прибыль в сумме около 4,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов, Бегимжан намерена и далее развивать животноводство.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегимжан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Бегимжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Begimjan is the leader of the "Begimjan" group, married and raised four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 1998 with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Having seven dairy cows and five sheep in her business and making a profit of about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products, Begimjan intends to continue growing her animal husbandry business.  In order to further develop her business, Begimjan requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of young livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, tiene 29 años de edad, casada, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años; la socia tiene una tienda club de atención de productos herbalife; además se dedica al comercio de granos de maíz los fines de semana en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba en Cusco - Perú.
La señora Victoria requiere el crédito para comprar Maíz y luego venderlo como semilla.

Victoria ha experimentado un crecimiento dentro de estas actividades y sigue trabajando para seguir desarrollándose en estas actividades.
 La señora valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
 Victoria pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Victoria, 29, is married and has a 7 year old son.  She has a membership store where she sells Herbalife products and also sells corn kernels on weekends in Ollantaytambo District, Urubamba Province in Cusco-Perú.

Victoria needs the loan to buy corn to then resell as seed.  Victoria has experienced growth in these activities and she continues working to continue developing in them.  She values and is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her debt payments in a disciplined way.  Victoria belongs to the “San Rafael” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy corn kernels to sell as seed.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
María Alexandra Actualmente trabaja de Maestra,  es una joven  con valores, deseos  de superación,   Madre de  dos  hijos a  su cargo, los cuales quiere darles un futuro mejor con un techo digno y seguro.

Es por tal razón,  se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para  compra de Cementó, Arena Y ladrillo, debido a que ha estado un poquito afectado con los fenómenos que han transcurrido en la zona, esto le permitirá obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María Alexandra is currently employed as a teacher.  She’s a young woman with values and a desire for self-improvement. She’s the mother of two children in her care that she wants to provide a better future for and a safe, secure and proper home.

With this in mind, she came by Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy cement, sand and bricks because the phenomena the zone has suffered lately have affected her a bit and this will make it possible for her to obtain better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 57 years old, married with 2 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Editha has a general store business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 11000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Editha has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zabira

texts.ru: Забира – участник группы «Бегимжан», 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Забира занимается животноводством и полеводством, имеет в хозяйстве 1  теленка, 11 овец, 5 коз и 6 ягнят. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Забира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Забира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Zabira is a participant of the "Begimjan" group.  She is 45 years old, married and raising four children.  Zabira is involved in animal husbandry and farming and has one calf, eleven sheep, five goats and six lambs in her business.  In order to further develop her business, Zabira requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of young livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Дилшод занимается торговлей. Он уже год как открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Dangara district.  He is 31 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Dilshod is involved in sales.  He opened a food market one year ago.  He is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Maripat

texts.ru: Марипат  59 лет, вдова, воспитала двух детей.   В 2001 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Марипат начала свой бизнес в торговле, стартовав с суммы 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Марипат сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 25,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Марипат  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Марипат  планирует частично отложить на свадьбу младшего сына, и часть – вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Maripat is 59 years old, a widow and raised two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in sales with an initial sum of 6,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Maripat was able to grow her business to have a monthly income of 25,000 som (KGS).  Today, her merchandise selection is limited, and this is why Maripat requested a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise selection.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan partially into her youngest son's wedding and partially into developing her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Edith Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 12, 11  y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores  estudian dos en colegio y el otro en  escuela. El marido es carpintero.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja los últimos tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas que hay ya que estas le dejan mejores ganancias ya que luego las vende al precio normal y así gana más, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Ella está repitiendo su crédito en el Banco y nos cuenta que con el que recibió logro comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para el estudio de sus hijos que ya iniciaron su periodo escolar y si no fuera por eso ellos no podrían estudiar, ya que lo que gana su marido no les alcanza para esto. Este crédito lo quiere utilizar para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches.  Most residents here are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Edith, 33, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 15, 12, 11 and 2 years of age.  The three older ones attend school, two go to secondary school and the other one is in elementary school.  Her husband’s a carpenter.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works the three last days of the week.  She sells on credit and collects payment every 8 days.  She tells us that she takes advantage of special offers because they produce higher profits when she resells them at regular prices thus earning more that way.  What she sells the most is perfume and cosmetics.  She’s been in this line of work for three years and she does very well.

She is repeating her loan in the bank and she tells us that with the one she got before she was able to buy certain things needed for her children’s schooling since the school term has started and if it weren’t for that they wouldn’t have been able to attend school because what her husband earns doesn’t stretch far enough for this.  She wants this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

This is her fifth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio habita en la ciudad de Estelí, padre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas. El inicio con este de negocio de reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicleta hace 10 años cuando regreso de su viaje de Estados Unidos, el quería poner un negocio con lo que logro ahorrar y así lo hizo desde entonces este se ha convertido en su primer negocio después se compro un pequeño bus el cual utiliza para transportar a niños a la escuela durante la mañana se dedica a llevar y traer a estudiantes a la escuela en la tarde se dedica atender su negocio de reparación de bicicleta negocio en el cual su hijo mayor le ayuda, es de esta manera que se gana la vida y sostiene a su familia. El requiere el crédito para comprar rodaje para el bus , pues necesita tener en buenas condiciones mecánica su bus y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes en este caso los estudiantes que a diario lleva y trae de la escuela. Uno de sus proyectos es comprar un microbús más grande que sea más económico para disminuir un poco el uso de combustible, y seguir mejorando y ampliando su negocio de reparación de bicicletas.
texts.en:
Mauricio lives in the city of Estelí.  He’s the father of three children and is a businessman.  By profession he’s a bicycle repairman.  He started this bicycle repair and spare parts business ten years ago when he returned from his trip to the United States.  He wanted to open a business with what he had managed to save up and he did so.  Since then it’s become his first business.  Afterwards, he bought a small school bus that he uses to transport children to school during the week.  In the morning he works transporting children to school and in the afternoon he works in his bicycle repair business where his oldest son helps him.  This is how he earns his livelihood and supports his family.

He needs the loan to buy tires for the bus because he has to have the bus in good mechanical condition to provide good customer service, in this case to the students he takes to and brings back from school every day.  One of his projects is to buy a larger mini bus that’s more economical to cut back a bit on fuel consumption and to continue improving and enlarging his bicycle repair business.

loans.use: to buy tires for the bus.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing retail business in the Philippines. Joyce requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like t-shirts, blouses and footwear to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Joyce would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like t-shirts, blouses and footwear.

loans.name: Judeliza

texts.en:
Judeliza is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Judeliza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 17,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergents, shampoo & beverages.
Judeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Judeliza hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, bath soap, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has making and selling native hat in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Veronica is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native hat weaving.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business to support her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native hat weaving business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 57 years old and widowed with four children.

Felisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods such as soft-drinks, rice, feed and other groceries to sell.

Felisa has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine.

Felisa aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production and utensils. She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production and utensils.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is in her mid-50s, and is a widow with five grown-up children.  She has been running a business selling vegetables for 10 years now, and also sells juice, water and sodas. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy extra items, and cover household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her supplies of vegetables to resell, and also to increase her inventory of water, juice and sodas.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Cecilia will share this loan with her loan group "Paradise", which has a total of 15 members.  They hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell, and increase inventory of water, juice and sodas.

loans.name: Jessenia Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años el mismo que este año empieza a estudiar en el jardín de infantes. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar hace más de tres años emprendió un negocio, al principio empezó con la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y sabanas, después con el paso del tiempo fue aumentado su negocio y ahora también vende pañales desechables, bebidas como sodas, energizantes, entre otras cosas, esto lo realiza en su casa en el cual tiene un pequeño local aunque de vez en cuando también se va a ofrecer de puerta en puerta sus productos. Nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos ella ha podido ir aumentando su negocio. 

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sabanas, zapatillas y otros productos que vende en su local. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora cada vez su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches.  Most residents here are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Jessenia, 25, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four year old son who will start kindergarten this year.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good housewife who in order to help her husband with household expenses three years ago started a new business.  At first she started out selling shoes, sandals and sheets and as time went by she started expanding the business and now she also sells disposable diapers, soft-drinks and energy drinks, among others.  She does this from home where she has a little store although sometimes she also goes out with her products to offer them door to door.  She tells us that thanks to the loans she’s been able to gradually increase her business.
 
She will use this loan to buy shoes, sandals and sheets and other products that she sells in her store.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She’s the treasurer and she likes it because with the loans each time she improves her business more.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 49 years old, married and has 4 children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Segundina has a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Segundina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Segundina would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
